page.title: 04BACKGROUND
page.content: The area surveyed by Fettes College includes the suburbs of Trinity, Goldenacre and Wardie and extends to the Firth of Forth at Lower Granton Road. The area is mainly {residential but a significant part of the district is given over to residential facilities. On Lower Granton Road are a series of builders, plumbers and electricians. The {Granton}area was developed by the Dukes of Buccleugh who built a harbour for the export of coal from their mines. The harbour also used to be a ferry port for Fife but is now used entirely for recreational purposes. {Trinity}was built on a plateau over- :looking the Forth in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. Many houses here are large and some original plots have been subdivided to allow more buildings to be built.
